answers.answer: The happy part of it is you got a blessing out of it. A baby:) in the end that's all that matters:)

Aaaaaahhhh..... I know exactly how you feel! After 31hrs in labour and slow dilation(even after inducing) my dr decided to rather do a c-section before things get too complicated. I had bad cry sessions because I was reading about successful labour stories and how I wasn't able to experience it myself. This only eased up about 2-3 mths after, I started convincing myself it was for the best, my baby is finally safe in my arms and that with next baby we could plan on when he/she will arrive. It got me all excited, especially now that we're pregnant again. Keep your head held up high momma and enjoy your precious bundle of joy*

I'm just mad I wasn't able to hold my baby right away n do skin to skin :( n her dad not cutting the umbilical cord it's so upsetting I didn't want that! But yea I tell myself all that matters is that me n baby are fine bc I had all kinds of things wrong with me I was developing preeclampsia too

question: It's been a month already and I still cAnt get over the fact that I had to get a c section I'm so jealous of the people who get induce n don't end up with a c section my whole pregnancy was complicated and than to top it off I don't get to experience the whole natural delivery n my water breaking on its own I get upset thinking about it :((
title: Upset and jealous
